description: Government action affects us all. We pay taxes; we use public roads, schools, and parks. Some prices we pay are lower due to government subsidies; others are higher due to taxes. Government actions influence both the efficiency of our economy and the equity and equality within our society. Students learn valuable analytical tools for evaluating public projects, tax policies, entitlement programs and voting behavior. Offered annually. Prerequisite: ECON 262 and either ECON 263 or STAT 272, completion of BTS-T, or permission of instructor.
name: Econ of Public Policy
notes: Open only to seniors during web registration.
Juniors may add on a space-available basis during drop/add period with
prerequisites: ECON 262 and either ECON 263 or STAT 272, completion of BTS-T, or permission of instructor.
title: Economics of Public Policy
